program atcoder_ABC132_A
  implicit none
  character(len=255) :: s 
  integer :: count(0:255) = 0
  logical :: ok = .true.

That works. Thus corrected:

program atcoder_ABC132_A
  implicit none
  character(len=255) :: s 
  integer :: count(0:255) = 0
  logical :: ok = .true.
  integer :: i, len_s
  integer :: num_two =0, c
  read(*, '(A)') s
  len_s = len_trim(s)
  if (len_s /=4) then
     print *, 'No'
     stop
  end if

  do i =1, len_s
    c = ichar(s(i:i))
    count(c) = count(c)+1
  end do

  num_two =0
  ok = .true. do i=0,255
     if (count(i) ==0 ) cycle
     if (count(i)/=2 ) then
        ok = .false. exit
     else
        num_two = num_two +1
     end if
  end do

  if (ok .and. (num_two ==2) ) then
     print *, 'Yes'
  else
     print *, 'No'
  end if
end program atcoder_ABC132_A

program atcoder_ABC132_A
  implicit none
  character(len=255) :: s 
  integer :: count(0:255) = 0
  logical :: ok = .true.
  integer :: i, len_s
  integer :: num_two =0, c
  read(*, '(A)') s
  len_s = len_trim(s)
  if (len_s /=4) then
     print *, 'No'
     stop
  end if

  do i =1, len_s
    c = ichar(s(i:i))
    count(c) = count(c)+1
  end do

  num_two =0
  ok = .true.
  do i=0,255
     if (count(i) ==0 ) cycle
     if (count(i)/=2 ) then
        ok = .false.
        exit
     else
        num_two = num_two +1
     end if
  end do

  if (ok .and. (num_two ==2) ) then
     print *, 'Yes'
  else
     print *, 'No'
  end if
end program atcoder_ABC132_A
